channel.title: Shops and Graphics?
channel.description:
Hey Can someone describe in detail or post a good tutorial on how to creat a shop and link it to a NPC?
Also how do you add graphics (like rocks and Statues and stuff)?
You can just answer one you dont have to do both =) If you need to Team View im open to that.

item.title: Shops and Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @Tomkruz Tomkruz
item.description:
@Tomkruz wrote:

A Shop:

Client.java

Search:

wanneshop

then add

} else if (NPCID == $) {
PutNPCCoords = true;
WanneShop = $$;

$ = NPCID
$$ = Shop number

Save, compile.

Go into Shops.cfg

make something like this

Shop = id presstab ShopName tab Item tab Amount Item tab Amount

Where it says tab, press the tab button on your keyboard…

To make objects:

Search:

makeGlobalObject

in client.java

OR

Search:

Createobj

in client.java

Example: makeGlobalObject(3333, 3333, objectId, 0, 10)

Read full topic

item.title: Shops and Graphics?

item.description:
@adecker wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: Shops and Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @DePredaTe DePredaTe
item.description:
@DePredaTe wrote:

It’s not that hard really. and it’s better if you learn yourself. Here, i’ll post a small guide:

Go to autospawn.cfg and spawn the NPC you want to spawn. Now, after you have saved that file go to your client.java and look for something like this

            } else if (NPCID == **) { 
                PutNPCCoords = true;
                WanneShop = **;

Something like that. Now, enter the NPCs ID where the first two *'s are. now for WanneShop, go ahead and add the number 60 (it can be any number but it can't be the same number that a shop already has!)

now go to shops.cfg and add at the very bottom

shop = 60	Christmas_Store			AMOUNTTOBUY	AMOUNTTOSELL	ITEMID	ITEMAMOUNT

you can add more than one item if you want, but that is how you do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Shops and Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @DePredaTe DePredaTe
item.description:
@DePredaTe wrote:

adecker, i have yet to see a good shop adding tutorial. I had to figure it out for myself.
For the adding graphics part, there is another board for this that would help you out WAY more than we could. Because adding graphics is client side, not server side.

Read full topic
